jibe.sdk.client.chatsession
Class ChatSessionService

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.JibeServiceBase<IChatSession>
      jibe.sdk.client.chatsession.ChatSessionService

public class ChatSessionService
extends JibeServiceBase<IChatSession>

The Jibe Service for session-based chat, via MSRP.

getUsersInChatSession

public java.lang.String[] getUsersInChatSession(long sessionId)
                                         throws JibeServiceException
Gets a list of the user IDs of all users within the specified chat session. The user identifiers are only valid within the community in which the chat was created. The community can be identified using getCommunityId(long).

Parameters:
sessionId - The relevant session ID.
Returns:
An array of the IDs of all of the users currently active within a chat, plus the ID of the owner (the original creator) of the chat.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

getGroupChatSessionInfo

public GroupInfo getGroupChatSessionInfo(long sessionId)
                                  throws JibeServiceException
Gets the information for the specified chat session.

Parameters:
sessionId - The relevant session ID.
Returns:
An GroupInfo object, giving such information as the members of the group.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

getChatSessionByUser

public ChatSessionServiceResult getChatSessionByUser(java.lang.String remoteUserId)
                                              throws JibeServiceException
Used to search for a chat session within which we have an active conversation with the specified remote user. The ChatSessionServiceResult that gets returned will contain the session ID of that session, if an active conversation with that user exists.

Parameters:
remoteUserId - The remote user's ID.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

getSessionState

public ChatSessionServiceResult getSessionState(long chatSessionId)
                                         throws JibeServiceException
Gets the current state for the session. The result code of the result object will contain the code for the state. It may be one of the following values:

ChatSessionServiceResult.CHATSESSION_STATE_UNKNOWN,

ChatSessionServiceResult.CHATSESSION_STATE_ESTABLISHING,

ChatSessionServiceResult.CHATSESSION_STATE_ESTABLISHED or

ChatSessionServiceResult.CHATSESSION_STATE_TERMINATING

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the chat-session's state.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

startChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult startChatSession(int communityId,
                                                 java.lang.String remoteUserId)
                                          throws JibeServiceException
Starts a new chat session with the specified user. The supplied user identifier must be valid within the specified community.

Parameters:
communityId - The ID of the community within which the remote user exists.
remoteUserId - The ID of the remote user.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing containing the result code for the operation, together with the session ID of the created chat session (if successful).
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

startChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult startChatSession(int communityId,
                                                 java.lang.String remoteUserId,
                                                 java.lang.String message)
                                          throws JibeServiceException
Starts a chat session with the specified user, passing an initial message to them.

Parameters:
communityId - The ID of the community within which the remote user exists.
remoteUserId - The remote user's ID within that community.
message - An initial chat-session message that is to be sent to the remote user.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation, together with the session ID of the created chat session (if successful).
Throws:
JibeServiceException

startGroupChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult startGroupChatSession(int communityId,
                                                      java.lang.String[] remoteUserId)
                                               throws JibeServiceException
Starts a new group-chat session, with the given list of users.

Parameters:
communityId - The ID of the community within which the users exist.
remoteUserId - A list of the user IDs of all the users who are to be added to the created chat.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation, plus the chat-session ID of the created chat session.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

startGroupChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult startGroupChatSession(int communityId,
                                                      java.lang.String[] remoteUserId,
                                                      java.lang.String message)
                                               throws JibeServiceException
Starts a new chat session with the given list of users. The supplied message is sent as the initial message through the created chat session.

Parameters:
communityId - The ID of the community within which the users exist.
remoteUserId - A list of the user IDs of all the users who are to be added to the created chat.
message - An initial chat-session message that is to be sent to the remote users.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation, plus the chat-session ID of the created chat session.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

endChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult endChatSession(long chatSessionId)
                                        throws JibeServiceException
Ends the given chat session. Ending a chat means that the chat session will be closed, and all users within the chat session will be dropped from the chat. This operation is usually only valid when issued by the owner (creator) of the chat session.

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The affected chat-session ID.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

joinChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult joinChatSession(long chatSessionId)
                                         throws JibeServiceException
Attempt to join a specified chat session. This operation is performed in response to an incoming chat invitation request, i.e. the user must have previously been invited to join the specified conversation: users cannot just arbitrarily join existing conversations. . The relevant chat session's ID will have been previously been signaled within an Intent JibeIntents.ACTION_INCOMING_CHATSESSION sent to the user, and it can be obtained by reading the JibeIntents.EXTRA_SESSION_ID as a long value, from the Intent.

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session that the user wishes to join.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

leaveChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult leaveChatSession(long chatSessionId)
                                          throws JibeServiceException
Attempt to leave a specified chat session. Closes chat connection from user to the remote endpoint. If the given chat is a multiuser chat and has more participants, the chat session stays open. Otherwise this operation should behave like the endChatSession(long) method.

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The concerned chat session id
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

addUserToChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult addUserToChatSession(long chatSessionId,
                                                     java.lang.String remoteUserId)
                                              throws JibeServiceException
Invites a remote user to join a specified chat session. The remote user will be sent an invitation to join the specified chat session. The remote user can then decide whether (or not) to join the session.

Parameters:
remoteUserId - The ID of the remote user that is being invited to join the chat.
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session that the user is being invoted to join.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

removeUserFromChatSession

public ChatSessionServiceResult removeUserFromChatSession(long chatSessionId,
                                                          java.lang.String remoteUserId)
                                                   throws JibeServiceException
Removes the specified user from a chat session. This will request the chat server (in the case of a centralized group chat) or the multi-user chat focus, to remove the specified user from the specified chat session. This operation is restricted to the owner (creator) of the chat session.
If there were only two users in the conversation (the owner and the remote user) then the remote user will be removed, leaving only the owner in the conversation, at which point the chat session will automatically be closed.

Parameters:
remoteUserId - The ID of the user to be removed from the chat.
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session from which to remove the remote user.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendTextMessage

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendTextMessage(long chatSessionId,
                                                java.lang.String message)
                                         throws JibeServiceException
Sends a text-based message to all of the remote parties that are currently active within the specified chat.

Parameters:
message - The text of the message to be sent.
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session to which the message is to be sent.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendMessage

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendMessage(long chatSessionId,
                                            java.lang.String contentType,
                                            byte[] content)
                                     throws JibeServiceException
Sends a binary message to all of the remote parties that are currently active within the specified chat.

Parameters:
contentType - The content type of the data that is to be sent.
content - The message content, held as a byte array.
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session to which the message should be sent.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendPrivateTextMessage

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendPrivateTextMessage(long chatSessionId,
                                                       java.lang.String remoteUser,
                                                       java.lang.String message)
                                                throws JibeServiceException
Sends a private, text-based message to one particular user within a chat-session (as opposed to sending to all of the remote parties that are currently active within the specified chat).

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session.
remoteUser - The ID of the remote user to whom the private message is to be sent. This user must be a part of the specified chat session.
message - The text of the message to be sent.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendPrivateMessage

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendPrivateMessage(long chatSessionId,
                                                   java.lang.String remoteUser,
                                                   java.lang.String contentType,
                                                   byte[] content)
                                            throws JibeServiceException
Sends a private, binary message to one particular user within a chat-session (as opposed to sending to all of the remote parties that are currently active within the specified chat).

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session.
remoteUser - The ID of the remote user to whom the private message is to be sent. This user must be a part of the specified chat session.
contentType - The content type of the data that is to be sent.
content - The message content, held as a byte array.
Returns:
A Result object, containing the result code of the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendIndicator

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendIndicator(long chatSessionId,
                                              int indicator)
                                       throws JibeServiceException
Sends an indicator (INFO_COMPOSING_ACTIVE/INFO_COMPOSING_IDLE/etc.) to all of the remote parties that are members of the specified chat.

Parameters:
indicator - The ID of the indicator to send. See ChatSessionEvent.
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session to which the notification should be sent.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendPrivateIndicator

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendPrivateIndicator(long chatSessionId,
                                                     java.lang.String remoteUser,
                                                     int indicator)
                                              throws JibeServiceException
Sends an indicator (INFO_COMPOSING_ACTIVE/INFO_COMPOSING_IDLE/etc.) to only one specific remote party within the specified chat.

Parameters:
chatSessionId - The ID of the chat session to which the notification should be sent.
remoteUser - The ID of the remote user to whom the private indicator is to be sent. This user must be a part of the specified chat session.
indicator - The ID of the indicator to send. See ChatSessionEvent.
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException.
JibeServiceException

sendReport

public ChatSessionServiceResult sendReport(int communityId,
                                           java.lang.String remoteUserId,
                                           java.lang.String messageId,
                                           int report)
                                    throws JibeServiceException
Sends a delivery/read report for a message. * @param communityId The ID of the community within which the remote user exists.

Parameters:
remoteUserId - The ID of the remote user.
messageId - The ID of the message for which this report is being sent.
report - The report identifier (for example, REPORT_POSITIVE_DELIVERY: see ChatSessionReport for possible values).
Returns:
A ChatSessionServiceResult object, containing the result code for the operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException
